episodes.title: Pregnant at 17 & Punished by the Cult | Our Jehovah’s Witness Story
episodes.description:
We were 17 years old, in love, and pregnant with our first daughter.
What followed wasn’t support—it was punishment.
In this video, we share what happened after we told the elders in the Jehovah’s Witnesses about our pregnancy. We were called into a judicial meeting with three elders, asked deeply personal questions, and then given very different outcomes: one of us was reproved, the other disfellowshipped.
Because of that decision, we were forced to stay apart for 11 months during the pregnancy.
We were only allowed to see each other a handful of times.
We were told to treat our relationship like a business transaction.
And we were too young, scared, and conditioned to be as outraged as we should have been.
Looking back now, the emotional damage is impossible to ignore.
We’re grateful beyond words for our daughter—but we still grieve the time that was taken from us. This video is us finally saying out loud what we didn’t know how to say back then.
If you’ve experienced religious control, shunning, or separation—or if you’re questioning your faith—we hope our story helps you feel less alone.

episodes.title: How Leaving Jehovah’s Witnesses Rewired Our Brains (The Part No One Talks About)
episodes.description:
For most of our lives, we were taught that this life didn’t really matter.
As Jehovah’s Witnesses, we believed the real life would come later — after Armageddon, in a “new system,” on a paradise earth. That belief quietly shaped everything: our goals, our urgency, our relationships, and even how we understood time itself.
In this video, we open up about what happens after you leave that belief behind.
Leaving Jehovah’s Witnesses didn’t just change what we believed — it rewired our brains. Suddenly, forever disappeared. Time became finite. The weight of responsibility, family, purpose, and the fear of loss all hit at once. And with that came anxiety, grief, urgency… and the painful realization of how much time was already gone.
We talk honestly about:
How the “paradise earth” teaching affects motivation and goals
Why time doesn’t feel real when you believe you’ll live forever
The emotional crash that happens when that belief is gone
Why ex-Jehovah’s Witnesses often feel like they’re “behind” in life
And why kindness and patience matter so much for people leaving high-control religions
If you’ve left the Jehovah’s Witnesses — or any high-control religion — you are not broken. You’re relearning life in real time.
And if you’ve never been in one, we hope this helps you understand why leaving is so much more than just “walking away.”
Thanks for listening to our story. 🤍
— Andrew & Karen

episodes.title: Leaving the JW Life Behind… and Decorating Our First Christmas Tree ❤️🎄
episodes.description:
This video means more than we can put into words.
Growing up as Jehovah’s Witnesses, we never celebrated Christmas. No tree. No lights. No ornaments. We spent our whole lives watching the world around us celebrate something we weren’t allowed to experience.
But this year… everything changed.
Today, we decorated our very first Christmas tree — together, as a family — and it was emotional, funny, chaotic, and healing all at the same time. 🎄❤️
From choosing lights and ornaments to naming our tree “Eleanor” (because of course she needed a name 😂), this moment is something we’ll remember forever.
It’s more than a tree.
It’s freedom.
It’s reclaiming memories we never got to have.
It’s choosing joy — finally, on our own terms.
If you grew up in a high-control religion or you’re on your healing journey too, just know:
You’re not alone. And it’s never too late to create new traditions.
Thank you for being here for our very first Christmas season.
More memories are on the way. ✨

episodes.title: Our First Christmas Tree — Reclaiming the Life We Missed 🎄🥹
episodes.description:
This is the Christmas we never had. ❤️
We both grew up in an environment where holidays were forbidden — no Christmas tree, no lights, no gifts, no traditions.
Every December, we watched the world celebrate something we weren’t allowed to touch.
We spent our entire childhoods and most of our adult lives never experiencing what so many people consider a normal part of growing up.
This year… we finally stepped into the life we always dreamed of.
Today, we went Christmas tree shopping for the VERY first time in our lives.
Not as kids.
Not as teenagers.
As adults… finally free to create our own traditions.
And it hit us harder than we expected.
From getting ready together, wandering the tree farm, laughing through our clueless choices, arguing over “chunky” vs “juicy” trees 😂, to cutting down the one that felt like ours — every moment carried meaning.
This wasn’t just a Christmas vlog.
It was healing.
It was reclaiming.
It was choosing joy after years of missing it.
And when we brought that tree home… it wasn’t just a tree.
It was proof that we escaped something that once controlled our lives and took simple childhood moments away from us.
Now, we get to build everything from scratch — on our terms.
To anyone who grew up the way we did…
We hope this video gives you hope.
It’s never too late to create the childhood you deserved. ❤️
Thank you for being here for our FIRST Christmas — ever.
🎄✨ A new life starts today.

episodes.title: From Tragedy to Love: Our Story of Survival and Second Chances
episodes.description:
We’ve shared the fun, playful side of our relationship online — but this is the story behind the smiles. ❤️
In this video, we open up about our childhoods, our time growing up as Jehovah’s Witnesses, and the tragedy that changed everything. Karen shares the heartbreaking story of losing her brother Greg, and how those dark moments shaped the people we are today.
This isn’t just a story about pain — it’s about resilience, faith, and finding light again.
It’s about two kids who met at a Kingdom Hall, lost touch, faced unimaginable trauma… and somehow found each other again.
If you’ve ever wondered how love can grow out of brokenness, or how two people can build a life after losing so much — this one’s for you. 🕊️✨
🔔 Subscribe for more of our real, unfiltered story — the laughter, lessons, and love that built us.
#LoveStory #HealingJourney #JehovahsWitness #SurvivorStory  #KarenAndAndrew

episodes.title: Never Stop Being Each Other’s Crush: Marriage Tip #3 (Part 3 of 3)
episodes.description:
Welcome to Part 3 of our Couple Who Plays Too Much series! 💕 In this final episode, we’re diving into one of our best-kept relationship secrets — the little daily things that keep the spark alive after 20+ years together. We’re talking real-life tips, plenty of laughs, and a little bit of that flirty banter you’ve come to expect from us.

If you’ve been with us for Parts 1 and 2, you know we’re all about keeping love fun, playful, and strong — and this one might just be the game-changer for your relationship. Whether you’re dating, married, or somewhere in between, we’ve got something here for you.

👫 Andrew & Karen — the couple who plays too much — here to remind you: love is better when you laugh together.

episodes.title: Think You Know Your Partner? Think Again. | Marriage Tip #2 (Part 2 of 3)
episodes.description:
This is Part 2 of our 3-part series on how to stay close, stay real, and stay married—with a little chaos and a lot of love.

Today’s tip is simple but deep: get to know your partner for real.
We’re talking about triggers, arguments, past wounds, and why knowing what actually hurts or comforts your person can change everything.

Whether you're 3 months in or 20 years deep, Marriage Tip #2 will hit home.
Expect honesty, laughs, and a little too much truth—because we’re still the couple who plays too much, and we keep it all the way real.

episodes.title: Love Each Other? Cool. Like Each Other? That’s the Magic | Marriage Tip #1 (Part 1 of 3)
episodes.description:
Love is easy. Liking each other after 20+ years? That’s the real flex.
This is Part 1 of our 3-part series on the things that have actually helped us stay close, stay silly, and stay married.

In this episode, we’re sharing Marriage Tip #1—something simple but powerful that’s helped us keep the spark (and the laughs) alive.
Expect some real talk, some nonsense, and a lot of chemistry. Because we’re the couple who plays too much, and we wouldn’t have it any other way.
